justification: It notes B’s WR depth and frames a playoff push, but ignores B’s consensus-driven valuations: trading a Tier 2 WR (Isaiah) and Tier 2 RB (Roberts) for a Tier 5 RB (Robinson) is implausible. B prefers young ascending, healthy players; Isaiah’s minor Q plus losing Roberts makes acceptance unlikely. A’s injury-cautious profile clashes with targeting a Q WR. The rationale is generic and doesn’t engage tiers, roles, or playoff schedules. The 0.6 acceptance probability is unrealistic.
